newsitem.title: UK: Tax efficient Highland Timber plans further offer.
newsitem.headline: Tax efficient Highland Timber plans further offer.

text.p: Forestry group Highland Timber Plc said on Wednesday it plans a further offer for subscription following its initial offer last week.
The initial placing raised 6.8 million stg.
The group said will offer shares for subscription at the original price of 120p per share.
Highland said the demand for the shares was fuelled by the impending UK budget because investments in timber are tax efficient in terms of inheritance tax relief, EIS and rollover relief.
The group said the expected closing date for the second offer will be mid-June, subject to demand, but did not specify the amount of money to be raised.

Highland has bought the three UK forests identified in the initial prospectus and is now looking to buy a forest in New Zealand where the group said timber grows approximately 40 to 50 per cent quicker than in the UK.
A prospectus for the second offer will be available at the beginning of June.
